XV. Heracleon siderion (“ ironwort ”) is yet another discovery of Hercules. It has a slender stem about four fingers high, a flower of a deep red and leaves like those of coriander. It is found near ponds and rivers, and heals very thoroughly all wounds inflicted b iron.²'

yXVI. A discovery of Chiron's was the vine called chironia, which I have mentioned in my section on the vines;c I have also mentioned a plant, the discovery of which is attributed to Minerva.d
